tweet: It’s also important to remember that the best ideas in Congress don’t start there. Which is why bringing people who live these issues every day together to talk is another critical step towards addressing the challenges we see in our community.

How are we going to do it? Well we started by passing parts of the SERVICE Act, which I introduced with @RepStefanik, through the NDAA. This will help provide resources to help lower the military spouse unemployment rate, which is 6x the national avg.

Helping our service members and military families is one of the most important things this Congress can do. I was proud to bring leaders of our community together today to discuss how we can help them get the economic security they deserve. pic.twitter.com/ynKStrGpRj – at Ocean County College
Spending some time in Toms River today and brought lunch to thank our hard working interns. pic.twitter.com/pLjRnklTIs
Our next town hall is tonight in Riverside, but if you can't make it, we've got three more coming up in August. Check out my website to find out more. pic.twitter.com/yLMNxro24U
Our town hall is still on for tonight in Riverside. As always, everyone is invited. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/congressman-kim-town-hall-in-riverside-township-tickets-65808889159 …

It was an honor to get to welcome Col. Bridget Gigliotti to Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst as the new commander. I look forward to working with her to stand up for our service members in the years to come. pic.twitter.com/msCD3QaQuK

There's a lot of noise that comes out of Congress, but there are a lot of meaningful conversations that happen too. You may never know their names or see their faces, but our interns are such an important part of making sure everyone is heard and our office is at its best. To our interns, and all of you on and off the Hill, happy #NationalInternDay . pic.twitter.com/zlITLOcW86

Robocalls aren't just annoying, they're predatory weapons for criminals who target our communities. It's why I was proud to help pass the #StopBadRobocalls Act. Later today we're going to vote to make sure those men and women who responded on that tragic day nearly 18 years ago never have to worry about their care being taken away. It's the least we can do. The time is now to act. #Renew911VCF pic.twitter.com/J6mjUCTEkF

Congress has a strong role in deciding when we commit our servicemen and women to combat. For those at our Joint Base in New Jersey and everyone serving across the globe, I am committed to ensuring the voice of the people is heard before we enter another costly war.
Every one of the leaders who stood with me today has served in some way. We know the dangers Iran poses, but we also know that stumbling into a conflict can lead to disaster.

Today we begin debate on the floor on #NDAA, which is why I stood with @teammoulton, @RepJasonCrow @RepSherrill, @RepSlotkin, @RepGilCisneros and @votevets to deliver a message that the current AUMF shouldn't be used to justify military action against Iran. pic.twitter.com/l4M8Eg1WaZ
